clinical_study.brief_title: Methodological Developments for Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to optimize clinical MR protocols and to validate MR acquisition parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: Image quality based on standard imaging quality criteria
primary_outcome.description: Image quality criteria will be : Signal to Noise Ratio and Contrast to Noise Ratio measured in arbitrary units. absence of blurring and artefacts will be assessed by at least one radiologist according to an ordinal scale

secondary_outcome.description: For quantitative studies such as T1/T2 studies a T1/T2 quantification will be calculated. These parameters will be reported in ms.
For functional MRI studies, brain activity will be described in terms of brain localisation based on blood oxygen level-dependent signal variation and its intensity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac function MRI sub studies: volume
secondary_outcome.description: For cardiac imaging, cardiac function will be evaluated. Parameters such as left ventricle (LV) and right ventricle (RV) end-diastolic volumes end-systolic volumes will be measured and reported in mL/m².

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac mass MRI sub studies: mass
secondary_outcome.description: For cardiac imaging, cardiac function will be evaluated. LV and RV mass index will be measured and reported in g/m2.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cardiac function MRI sub studies: ejection fraction
secondary_outcome.description: For cardiac imaging, cardiac function will be evaluated. Ejection fraction for both ventricles will be calculated and reported in %.
For diffusion studies, the apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) whic is a measure of the magnitude of diffusion (of water molecules) within tissue will be estimated (mm2/s).
The fractional anisotropy (FA) which is a scalar value between zero and one, which describes the degree of anisotropy of a diffusion process, could also be estimated.

arm_group.description: All subjects will have an MRI examination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- to be over 18 year-old,
- to be able to give an informed consent,
- to have underwent a pre-inclusion medical examination,
- to present no contraindication to MR examination,
- to be enrolled in a social security plan.
Exclusion Criteria:
- subject refusal,
- subject under a measure of legal protection,
- any contraindication to MR examination (active medical device, ferromagnetic foreign body, pregnancy, morbid obesity, claustrophobia, … ).
